steps.title: Cut out four square pieces of fabric the exact same size.
steps.content: Cut out four square pieces of fabric the exact same size. Make sure that if you are making a small messenger bag that it's around 12 inches (30.5 cm) in length and 10 inches (25.4 cm) in width.

steps.title: Two pieces are for your lining, and 2 pieces are for the outside of the bag.
steps.content: Two pieces are for your lining, and 2 pieces are for the outside of the bag. If you want extra body try using a fusible product such as craft fuse, décor bond or form-flex. This gets fused with an iron to the inside of the outer fabric pieces before you sew it.

steps.title: Sew the side seams with a 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) seam.
steps.content: Sew the side seams with a 1 ⁄ 2 inch (1.3 cm) seam.

steps.title: Sew the bottom with a 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) seam.
steps.content: Sew the bottom with a 1 ⁄ 2 inch (1.3 cm) seam.

steps.title: If you want you can box the bottom by measuring up 2 inches (5.1 cm) and creating a triangle measure in 2 inches (5.1 cm) sew across the diagonal.
steps.content: If you want you can box the bottom by measuring up 2 inches (5.1 cm) and creating a triangle measure in 2 inches (5.1 cm) sew across the diagonal.

steps.title: Do this to both the lining and the outer bag.
steps.content: Do this to both the lining and the outer bag.

steps.title: To sew the bag and the lining together turn the outer bag right side out.
steps.content: To sew the bag and the lining together turn the outer bag right side out. keep the lining right side in. place the outer bag into the lining and sew a 1 ⁄ 2 inch (1.3 cm) seam around the top of the bag to secure the two pieces together. at the bottom of the lining open the bottom of the seam about 4 inches (10.2 cm) so that you can birth the outer bag through the lining opening.

steps.title: Sew the lining back up by top-stitching the opening closed
steps.content: Sew the lining back up by top-stitching the opening closed

steps.title: Cut 2 handles at least 2 1/2 inches (5.1 cm) wide by however long you want your strap.
steps.content: Cut 2 handles at least 2 1/2 inches (5.1 cm) wide by however long you want your strap. For a handbag you can cut the handles 2 1/2 x 21 inches or if you want it to cross your body at least 2 1/2 x 40 inches.

steps.title: Sew handles right sides together using a 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) seam down the length of the fabric.
steps.content: Sew handles right sides together using a 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm) seam down the length of the fabric.

steps.title: Fold in the top and the bottom and top-stitch 1/8 around the handles and the bag.
steps.content: Fold in the top and the bottom and top-stitch 1/8 around the handles and the bag.

steps.title: Attach to the purse by measuring 2 1/4 inches (10.2 cm) down and 2 inches (5.1 cm) from the side.
steps.content: Attach to the purse by measuring 2 1/4 inches (10.2 cm) down and 2 inches (5.1 cm) from the side. this is where you mark to add your straps.

steps.title: Sew a box around the handle edges and then sew an x across to really secure the straps.
steps.content: Sew a box around the handle edges and then sew an x across to really secure the straps.
